thread.title: Lord Heseltine's Brexit plot shows his clear hatred for the Conservatives, so why is he still in the party?
thread.title_full: Lord Heseltine's Brexit plot shows his clear hatred for the Conservatives, so why is he still in the party?

author: Norman Tebbit
title: Lord Heseltine's Brexit plot shows his clear hatred for the Conservatives, so why is he still in the party?
text:
Y es, as pretty well everyone except Mr Corbyn and the fellow delusionists who surround him have noticed that last Thursday's by-election results were disastrous for Labour and very good for the Tories.
Not only did Labour do very badly, but as ever, just as Ukip seemed poised to make a great electoral breakthrough, they managed to muff it. As usual it was an inside job, nothing to do with policy, but all about Mr Nuttall's personal affairs and conduct .
It is as though everyone of note in that party carries a political suicide bomb primed and ready to be set off by an unknown hand hostile to the aims of Ukip.
In this column a fortnight ago I noted the continuing strength of the LibDems in local government by-elections and wondered whether that would be a harbinger of better times on the Parliamentary scene.
In fact it was. At both Stoke on Trent and at Copeland the Lib Dem vote, not just...
